items.name: Crowbar
items.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

items.name: Pouch
items.description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch (described earlier in this section).

traits: I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
I blow up at the slightest insult.
ideals: Honor. I don't steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
Greed. I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
People. I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
Redemption. There's a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
bonds: I'm trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
Someone I loved was killed because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
I'm searching for a treasure that will make me rich for the rest of my life.
flaws: When I see something valuable, I can't help but think about how to steal it.
When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
If there's a plan, I'll forget it. If I don't forget it, I'll ignore it.
I have a 'tell' that reveals when I'm lying.
I turn tail and run when things look bad.
An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I committed. I'm okay with that.

activeQuests.title: The First Step
activeQuests.description: You awake in a strange clearing. The air is fresh, but the silence is heavy. You must get your bearings.

objectives.description: Master the Booklet: View all pages (Character, Map, Quests, Equipment, Codex)
Study Your Gear: Examine an item in your inventory
Begin the Journey: Move to a neighboring hex

storySummary: started their journey as a Dragonborn Barbarian with the Criminal background.
lastNarrative: The plains wind carried the whispers of battle as Dam, a vision of defensive might, met a distant goblin’s challenge. Arrows flew like angry hornets, most finding only dust, until one of the goblin’s shafts found purchase in Dam's hide. But Dam, fueled by a primal rage, endured the barrage. The tide turned with a fierce twang, as Dam's final, true shot pierced the distance, felling the green-skinned menace and claiming a hard-won victory.

conversationHistory.content:
A throbbing ache behind your eyes is the first sensation, followed by the realization that you are lying on cold, damp earth. A thin layer of frost glitters on the stiff, brown grasses around you. The air, bitingly crisp, carries the scent of pine and something metallic, like old blood. You push yourself up, your dragonborn scales prickling with the chill, and find yourself in a vast, open plain. The morning sun, low and weak, casts long, distorted shadows, but offers little warmth. You have no memory of how you came to be here, only the name 'Dam' echoes in the void where your past should be.

To your south, the plains stretch towards distant, snow-capped mountains, their peaks gleaming like shattered crystal. Southeast, a dense, ancient forest looms, its dark canopy promising both shelter and peril. To the southwest, the land rises into rolling hills, while directly north, the jagged, broken stone of ancient ruins pierce the sky, their silence ominous. The jungles to your northeast and northwest appear as verdant, impenetrable walls. A strange, unfamiliar symbol, a crude carving of a coiled serpent, is etched into the ground a few feet from where you lay, almost swallowed by the frost.

As you stand, a gust of wind whips across the plains, carrying with it a swirl of dead leaves and a fine, gritty dust that stings your eyes. You feel a sudden, intense craving for water, your throat dry and raspy. What do you do?

The plains stretch out around you, a seemingly endless expanse of dry, winter-kissed grass. To the south, you discern the ordered lines of farmland, a stark contrast to the untamed wilderness you're currently in. Further south beyond the farmland, the distant silhouette of mountains rises, their peaks dusted with snow. To the southeast, a dense forest looms, dark and silent. The southwest reveals rolling hills, their gentle slopes hinting at hidden valleys. In the northeast and northwest, the thick, verdant canopy of a jungle dominates the horizon, suggesting a warmer, wetter climate than your current surroundings. Due north, the crumbling structures of ancient ruins stand sentinel against the morning sky, their secrets waiting to be unearthed. The rest of the distant horizon is shrouded in a pale, winter mist, obscuring whatever lies beyond. The air is crisp and cold, and the weak morning sun offers little warmth.

The morning sun casts long shadows across the plains as you stand amidst a vast expanse of forest. To the south, you see farmland, while enigmatic ruins lie to the north. Southeast, southwest, northeast, and northwest, the forest continues, dense and unexplored. In the distance, far to the south, mountains pierce the sky, and a stretch of tundra is visible to the southeast. More hills can be seen to the southwest, and plains to the far north. To the northwest, distant ruins hint at forgotten histories, while a far-off forest lies to the southwest and farmland to the northeast. The air is crisp, and the scent of pine needles fills your nostrils, a constant reminder of the wilderness surrounding you.
You focus your gaze on the lone goblin, a small, green-skinned creature with beady eyes and a crude scimitar in its hand. It snarls, clearly agitated.

As the goblin readies itself for another attack, you let out a guttural roar, adrenaline surging through your veins. Your muscles tense, and a primal fury ignites within you. You feel a surge of power, shrugging off the pain of your previous wounds as you enter a berserker's rage.

Dam, bloodied and breathing heavily, you hunker down amidst the sparse brush. The goblin, emboldened by your apparent vulnerability, cackles and prepares another attack. As you scan your surroundings, desperate for an advantage, your eyes catch a faint, almost imperceptible glint through the trees. It looks like a makeshift, abandoned lean-to, barely visible in the deep night. A faded red symbol, likely a cross, is just discernible on its tattered canvas. Could it be a first-aid station?

Dam, bloodied and weary, hunkers down, trying to catch his breath. As you brace yourself against a gnarled tree root, your hand brushes against loose earth and a small, leather-bound satchel. It feels oddly out of place, almost as if it was intentionally hidden. Peeking inside, you find two vials of a glowing red liquid – healing potions! A surge of renewed determination, and perhaps a touch of luck, washes over you.

The plains wind carried the whispers of battle as Dam, a vision of defensive might, met a distant goblin’s challenge. Arrows flew like angry hornets, most finding only dust, until one of the goblin’s shafts found purchase in Dam's hide. But Dam, fueled by a primal rage, endured the barrage. The tide turned with a fierce twang, as Dam's final, true shot pierced the distance, felling the green-skinned menace and claiming a hard-won victory.

codexEntries.title: Goblin: Scourge of the Shadows
codexEntries.content: Goblins, often referred to as the 'Scourge of the Shadows,' are small, humanoid creatures known for their cunning and malevolence. They stand at an average height of three feet, with a slender, wiry build that allows them to move swiftly and silently through their preferred habitats of dark forests, caverns, and abandoned ruins. Their skin is a sickly green or gray, and their eyes glow with an eerie, malevolent light, often described as 'the gaze of a predator.' Goblins possess sharp, pointed ears and a set of jagged, yellowed teeth that are well-suited for their carnivorous diet. Their hands are equipped with long, claw-like fingernails, which they use for both combat and climbing. Goblins are known to live in tightly-knit tribes, led by a single, dominant alpha. They are omnivorous, but prefer the taste of human flesh, which they believe grants them strength and courage. Goblins are also known to be skilled craftsmen, creating crude but effective weapons and tools from whatever materials they can scavenge. They are often accompanied by their loyal, if not somewhat dim-witted, wolf-like companions, known as 'Goblin Hounds.' Goblins are said to be able to communicate with these beasts, using a series of growls and snarls that only they understand. **Rumored Ecology:** Goblins are believed to have a complex social structure, with a strict hierarchy that is maintained through a series of rituals and challenges. They are also said to possess a form of magic, though it is crude and unpredictable. This magic is often used for illusions and minor enchantments, but can also be used to create small, magical creatures known as 'Goblin Spawn.' **Common Myths:** One of the most persistent myths surrounding goblins is that they are able to steal the souls of their victims, trapping them in a state of eternal torment. Another myth suggests that goblins are able to shapeshift, taking on the form of their prey in order to catch them off guard. **Flavor Quote:** 'I've faced many foes in my time, but none as cunning or as cruel as the goblins. They're like shadows, always lurking, always waiting. And when they strike, they strike with the ferocity of a storm. I've seen them tear apart entire villages, leaving nothing but ruin and despair in their wake. But I've also seen them cower and flee when faced with a strong enough foe. They're not invincible, but they're not to be underestimated either. They're the scourge of the shadows, and they'll stop at nothing to claim their next victim.' - Thalion, Veteran Adventurer

notifications.message: New codex entry created: Goblin: Scourge of the Shadows
